entry.title: In the Lowlight
entry.summary:
Author: magpietendencies (writtenintostars)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,497Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 26

Summary: There’s nothing recognizable about Jason, except maybe the way he zeroes in on you the second you step into the room. He always treated you that way, like you were what he was waiting for, the only reason he even showed up. “Jason.” You say when you remember how to talk again. You’re vaguely aware that you’re digging your nails into your palms. You tell yourself to blink, your eyes beginning to water, but you can’t bring yourself to, afraid you’ll find that Jason won’t be there anymore. “Hey, Mags,” the figure greets you, and it’s the first time anyone’s called you that in years. It makes sense that it would be Jason who uses the nickname. He gave it to you, after all. ~ You and Jason Todd spent your teen years together under Batman's tutelage and Bruce Wayne's care, your bond going much further than any words can describe. Six years after his apparent death, Jason reappears, both of you angry and dejected, teeming with love you don't know what to do with. You missed each other. ~ Updates the first Wednesday of each month.

entry.title: Follow The Leader
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,864Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 55

Summary: You were no hero nor vigilante, but you played your own role, assisting those who lived on the streets just like yourself. You would occasionally take on a dirty job of some description, whether that was a drug run, a stint in a brothel, whatever it took to get your hands on money. Then, you’d take your cut, disappear a while, and go around Gotham offering food, water, warm blankets, and other necessities to those who needed them. Children, adults, dirty, clean, old, young, didn’t matter to you. If they needed help, they got it. When some thugs come for revenge for a drug run gone wrong, you are saved by the Red Hood. But, as you are a criminal yourself, you are terrified of what he might do to you. He wants to show you he has no intention to hurt you.

entry.title: People Aren't Good
entry.summary:
Author: Miss_nightshade

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 32,461Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 55

Summary: Hecate has spent her life tucked into the bruised edges of Gotham’s Narrows, pretending to be a small, harmless girl with nothing worth noticing. It’s a fragile lie, but it holds. She goes to school. She walks home alone. She returns to a house that feels older than she is, a place that hums with magic she refuses to touch. She keeps her power buried. She ignores the ancient voices whispering inside her. She does everything she can to stay unseen. And for years, it works. Until the night it doesn’t.
